ROSE Fortran Support

This page describes some of the current collaboration with Rice to define the Fortran Support within ROSE.

Fortran Specific IR nodes

The handling of Fortran within ROSE requires the addition of a number of specific IR nodes to represent those concepts not already present in Sage III for C and C++.

New IR nodes are (built by Gina Goff):

  • New statements:
    1. SgProgramHeaderStatement
    2. SgProcedureHeaderStatement
    3. SgFortranDo
    4. SgInterfaceStatement
    5. SgParameterStatement
    6. SgCommonBlock
    7. SgModuleStatement
    8. SgUseStatement
    9. SgStopOrPauseStatement
    10. SgIOStatement
    11. SgIOControlStatement
    12. SgInputOutputStatement
    13. SgOpenStatement
    14. SgCloseStatment
    15. SgInquireStatment
    16. SgIOFileControlStmt
  • New expressions:
    1. SgIntrinsicFn
    2. SgSubscriptExpression
    3. SgSubscriptColon
    4. SgSubscriptAsterisk
    5. SgColon
    6. SgUseOnlyExpression
    7. SgUseRenameExpression
    8. SgIOItemExpression
    9. SgIOImpliedDo
    10. SgExponentiationOp (binary operator)
  • New symbols:
    1. SgIntrinsicSymbol
    2. SgInterfaceSymbol
    3. SgModuleSymbol
    4. SgCommonSymbol
Generated on 20 Jan 2013 for ROSE by  1.4.7
